When we consider the statement "The report might be accurate", we are focusing on only one of the two possibilities presented in the original statement. Since the original statement allows for the report to be accurate (as one of the possibilities), it is valid to infer that "The report might be accurate".

It's important to note that the inference "The report might be accurate" does not exclude the possibility of the report being revised. It simply narrows down the focus to one of the two possibilities presented in the original statement.
